lead_paragraph: The manipulation of testing procedures by the automaker’s engineers affected about 620,000 vehicles sold in Japan, the company’s president said.

byline.contributor: Neal E. Boudette contributed reporting from Ann Arbor, Mich.

headline.print_headline: Mitsubishi  Discloses It Cheated  on Fuel Test
headline.main: Mitsubishi Admits Cheating on Fuel-Economy Tests

snippet: The manipulation of testing procedures by the automaker’s engineers affected about 620,000 vehicles sold in Japan, the company’s president said.
abstract: Mitsubishi Motors admits it cheated on fuel-economy tests for ultrasmall car it makes in Japan; cheating affects about 620,000 cars sold starting in 2013; car maker is investigating whether false claims for fuel-economy affects other models.
